traffic lights.description: On the left side of the image, a red traffic light is visible, seemingly located at an intersection.
traffic lights.explanation: A red light indicates that the vehicle must stop and wait for the green light signal before it can proceed.

general_perception.description and explanation: In the traffic image under consideration, there are traffic lights present. On the left side of the image, there is a traffic light that is currently red, which is situated at what appears to be an intersection. The red light signifies that the vehicle must come to a complete stop and remain stationary until the light turns green before it can continue on its way. There are no vehicles, vulnerable road users, traffic signs, traffic cones, barriers, or other objects depicted in the image.

driving_suggestion: In view of the visible red traffic light ahead and the brake lights of vehicles, this car should come to a safe and complete stop at the designated stopping point. The headlights and all available night vision systems should be used to enhance visibility and situational awareness. This vehicle must wait until the traffic light turns green and the traffic ahead begins to move before proceeding. Due to low visibility, the speed should be reduced, following distance increased, and proper lighting used to improve visibility. Remain vigilant for road users or traffic control devices that may suddenly appear obscured due to darkness.

1.description and explanation: A traffic light displaying a red signal. Its purpose is to regulate the flow of vehicles at an intersection by providing visual cues indicating when it is safe to proceed. The red light instructs drivers to come to a complete stop. For the ego car, this means halting at the designated stopping point such as a crosswalk or stop line and waiting for the light to change to green before continuing.
